The vampire cannot actually fly, but can soar like a hang-glider. He also cannot carry anything (he needs his  hands  to  help  steer).  Maximum  speed  is  equal  to prevailing  winds,  or  15  miles/25  kilometers  per  hour in calm air.
The  vampire can  make  a  running  takeoff  and carry 20 pounds/10 kilograms while flying. Maximum speed is 30 miles/50 kilometers per hour.
The  vampire can  make  a  straight,  vertical takeoff if unencumbered, or can make a running takeoff carrying up to 50 pounds/25 kg. Maximum air speed is 45 miles/70 kilometers per hour.
The vampire can now make a vertical takeoff with up to 50 pounds/25 kg of baggage, but can carry up to 100 pounds/45 kg while flying. Maximum speed is 60 miles/95 kilometers per hour.
The  vampire can  now  carry  up  to  200 pounds/90  kg,  easily  enough  to  carry  away  an  adult person (or vampire). Maximum speed is 75 miles/120 kilometers per hour.

Time Attunement, Internal Recursion, Lapse, Subjective Suspension, Clotho's Gift
With your animalism prowess, you can easily convince a small animal to join you as a reliable companion.
You will corrupt this fool from afar, burning any humanity in his heart.
You will kill this fool with the most exquisite display of terror you can conjure upon his face. This should scare the other idiots into submission.
The very graphic horror of daimoinon will leave a veil of terror upon the court.
A swift and merciful death isn't your style. You intent to rule in Hell, and you clearly know the way to it...
You crossed the wrong foe for the last time. Your lasts hours will be spent in utter madness and terror.
With sufficient effort, you could use your mastery over illusions to make mortals forget about the most traumatic events recently happening in your realm.
You will choose between different ways to handle your current exposure.
You can't be everywhere at once, so you will need agents to propagate your grand illusion to the naive mortals.
Send a small number of trusted underlings to key locations.
This will be the greatest spell of all times!.
Spare no efforts, mortals must be astounded by your cunning trick.
Forget it, mortals are no threat anyway, right?
As an adept of Obeah, you have some peculiar abilities that could be of great help to your soldiers, if they know what to expect.
Preparing your troops will cost you time, and you will have to choose between several ways to train them.
Your loyal troops and followers have gathered, awaiting this training session with a mix of anticipation and unease.
Your clan is a master of small scale infiltration tactics.
Only strict discipline and planning can save you from extinction.
Even in your darkest hour, your clan still have friends and contacts everywhere.
Dismissed! I need to made up my mind first.
You are a master of Presence, a being of absolute power and authority. Time to prove it.
You will have to choose the target of your grand entrance..
Now is the time, who will be blessed with your graceful and endearing presence? Sadly, you can't be everywhere at once.
Your neighbors' mood could certainly be improved by an unplanned visit.
Go to the muddy mortals. Show them a true god.
One of your neighbors will be impressed durably by your show of majesty.
Too much work, my court kneeling before me is enough.
You can subtly probe the minds of your vassals to find any thoughts of disloyalty in them.
You will then have to choose the level of harshness you want to apply to the potential traitors.
It is time to enact your judgment, the harsher it is, the more it will scare away potential conspirators. But it will cost you some precious political capital.
Let them hate, as long as they fear.
Be harsh, be strict, but be fair about it.
For ten years, your vassals will be cowed.
No one will be able to deny the fairness of your judgment.
Six years of relative peace in the realm will ensue.
Fairness will buy you four years of internal peace.
Only two years will pass before the conspirators can start scheming again.
The call of the blood can never be satied. But this one will help avoid it for a time...
Draining this fool was refreshing and will please your ravenous beast for a while. It won't last forever though.
Let us plan our next hunt then...
You can use your considerable Obeah powers to soothe the Beast for a while, helping someone improve themselves.
You will choose one area of expertise to spend your free time away from the Beast's lure.
With the intoxicating power of Serpentis at your command, you can begin a campaign of rabid conversion in this province.
Your scheme was a resounding success, barring a few malcontents.
Your liege has used his considerable powers of Serpentis to convert one of your province ot his religion!
An useful tool of mass communication, this power can help you plan an efficient campaign of culture conversion in this province.
Your scheme was a resounding success, barring a few malcontents.
Your liege has used his considerable powers of Presence to convert one of your province ot his culture!
With your Auspex powers, you can find an unusually talented mortal to serve as a commander for your army.
Your find is now presented to the court, sparking jealousy and rumors among your fellows about the value of such a choice.
The other commanders seem particularly offended.
They will get over it, in time.
Your champion will certainly proves its worth soon.
With your current level of Animalism, you will have no issue finding an animal companion to your liking.
You recently used this power, give it some time.
Which animal will you soothe and call to your side?
Using Obeah, you can cure one of the target's vice or derangement.
With a simple touch, you can cause harm to another ruler from afar. A powerful blackmail tool.
You feel something... off about you since you spent the night with this strange diplomatic envoy from afar. And suddenly, you notice the letter at your desk.
An envoy has returned, confirming the success of your scheme. Your target now knows better than to cross you.
You could not approach your target enough to use your blood and proceed with your scheme. Furthermore, suspicions have been raised by your insistance to come close.
